<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	$
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 11%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	3,407
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The fair value accounting framework provides a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs to valuation techniques used to measure fair value.&#160; The hierarchy gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (level 1 measurements) and the lowest priority to unobservable inputs (level 3 measurements).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The three levels of the fair value hierarchy are described below:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="ZA397BE2DE7BE4123A9D20A5D0EB5316B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 49.7PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Level 1
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
	Inputs to the valuation methodology are unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets that the Company has the ability to access.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="ZF937648A5FB345C8BA53B77C04758764" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 49.5PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Level 2
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
	Inputs to the valuation methodology include:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT">
	- Quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT">
	- Quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in inactive markets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT">
	- Inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT">
	- Inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data by correlation or other means.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="Z4602BBE547634AABB0CF0847447F7FFC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 49.5PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Level 3
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
	Inputs to the valuation methodology are unobservable and significant to the fair value measurement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The asset&#8217;s or liability&#8217;s fair value measurement level within the fair value hierarchy is based on the lowest level of any input that is significant to the fair value measurement.&#160; Valuation techniques used need to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs.&#160; All of the Company&#8217;s investments in marketable securities are Level 1 assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	7.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Debt Obligations
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	On June 6, 2013, the Company obtained a credit facility (the &#8220;Facility&#8221;) from JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. (&#8220;JPMorgan&#8221;) pursuant to a credit agreement (the &#8220;Credit Agreement&#8221;) between the Company and JPMorgan.&#160; The maximum aggregate amount of the Facility is $25.0 million.&#160; Proceeds from the Facility will be used for working capital and to finance acquisitions.&#160; During the year ended April 30, 2015, the Company borrowed an additional $2.3 million under the Facility primarily to finance the acquisition of additional manufacturing equipment and repaid an aggregate of $6.4 million from its operating cash flow and as a result of redemptions of certain fixed income marketable securities.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	34
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#FREQUENCYELE10K043016_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160; -&#160; Continued
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	April 30, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company may make borrowings under the Facility, from either Tranche A or Tranche B or a combination of both, not to exceed $25.0 million.&#160; Pursuant to the Credit Agreement, the amount of Tranche A borrowings may not exceed the value of the Pledged Investments (as defined in the Credit Agreement).&#160; The amount of Tranche B borrowings may not exceed the lesser of (i) $15.0 million and (ii) the Borrowing Base (as defined in the Credit Agreement).&#160; Current outstanding borrowings under the Facility are all under Tranche A.&#160; The Facility is fully guaranteed by certain of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries and is secured by, among other things, a pledge of substantially all personal property of the Company and certain of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Borrowings under the Facility are evidenced by a line of credit note (the &#8220;Note&#8221;) and bear interest, payable monthly, at a rate equal to the LIBOR Rate, as determined from time to time by JPMorgan pursuant to the terms of the Note, plus a margin of 0.75% for Tranche A borrowings and 1.75% for Tranche B borrowings.
</FONT>
	&#160; At April 30, 2016 and 2015, the rate was 1.1913% and 0.9305%, respectively, based on the one-month LIBOR rate.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	The principal balance on the Note, along with any accrued and unpaid interest, is due and payable no later than June 5, 2018, which is the maturity date of the Facility.&#160; In addition, the Company is required to pay JPMorgan fees equal to 0.1% per annum on any unused portion of the Facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Credit Agreement contains a number of affirmative and negative covenants, including limitations on the incurrence of additional debt, liens on property, acquisitions, loans and guarantees, mergers, consolidations, liquidations and dissolutions, asset sales, and distributions and other payments in respect of the Company&#8217;s capital stock.&#160; The Credit Agreement also contains certain events of default customary for credit facilities of this type, including nonpayment of principal or interest when due, material incorrectness of representations and warranties when made, breach of covenants, bankruptcy and insolvency, unstayed material judgment beyond specified periods, and acceleration or payment default of other material indebtedness.&#160; The Credit Agreement requires the Company to maintain, as of the end of each fiscal quarter, a funded debt to EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization) ratio and, if there are any borrowings under Tranche B, an interest charge coverage ratio.&#160; The calculation of both ratios is defined in the Credit Agreement.&#160; For the year ended April 30, 2016, the Company met the required covenants for its borrowings under Tranche A.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company&#8217;s European subsidiaries have available 250,000 Euros (approximately $275,000 based on current rates of exchange between the dollar and the Euro) in a bank credit line to meet short-term cash flow requirements.&#160; As of April 30, 2016 and 2015, no amounts were outstanding under such line of credit.&#160; Borrowings under the bank credit line, if any, must be repaid within one year of receipt of funds.&#160; Interest on this credit line is at 1.0% over the EURO Interbank Offered rate (EURIBOR).&#160; At April 30, 2016 and 2015, the rate was 0.692% and 1.12% respectively, based on the one-month EURIBOR.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	8.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Accrued Liabilities
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	617
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>

</FONT>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#FREQUENCYELE10K043016_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27.35PT">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160; -&#160; Continued
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	April 30, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 24.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	9.
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PX; DISPLAY: INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH: 22.5PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	&#160;Investment in Morion, Inc.
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company has an investment in Morion, Inc., a privately-held Russian company, which manufactures high precision quartz resonators and crystal oscillators.&#160; The Company&#8217;s investment consists of 4.6% of Morion&#8217;s outstanding shares, accordingly, the Company accounts for its investment in Morion on the cost basis.&#160; This investment is included in other assets in the accompanying balance sheets.&#160; During the fiscal years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, the Company acquired product from Morion in the aggregate amount of approximately $140,000 and $201,000, respectively, and the Company sold product to Morion in the aggregate amount of approximately $845,000 and $615,000, respectively.&#160; At April 30, 2016, accounts receivable included $33,000 due from Morion and $37,000 was payable to Morion.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	On October 22, 2012, the Company entered into an agreement to license its rubidium oscillator production technology to Morion.&#160; The agreement required the Company to sell certain fully-depreciated production equipment previously owned by the Company and to provide training to Morion employees to enable Morion to produce a minimum of 5,000 rubidium oscillators per year.&#160; Morion will pay the Company approximately $2.7 million for the license and the equipment plus 5% royalties on third party sales for a 5-year period following an initial production run.&#160; During the same 5-year period, the Company commits to purchase from Morion a minimum of approximately $400,000 worth of rubidium oscillators per year although Morion is not obligated to sell that amount to the Company.&#160; During the fiscal year ended April 30, 2016, sales to Morion included $375,000 for product and training services under this agreement.&#160; Per the amended agreement, the balance of $1 million for the transfer of the license will be due once the United States Department of State (&#8220;State Department&#8221;) approves the removal of certain provisions of the original agreement.&#160; The State Department has approved the technology transfer called for under the agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	On March 29, 2016, the Company renegotiated the $1 million dollar amendment under the original agreement dated October 22, 2012 to $602,000 due to the U.S. Government easing of export regulations.&#160;&#160; Of this amount $392,500 was billed and paid during FY 2016 and the balance of $210,000 will be billed during FY 2017.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	10.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	During fiscal year 2004, the Company acquired FEI-Zyfer, Inc. (&#8220;FEI-Zyfer&#8221;).&#160; This acquisition resulted in the recording of $218,000 in goodwill.&#160; In February 2012, the Company acquired FEI-Elcom resulting in the recording of goodwill in the amount of $398,000 plus other intangible assets with a value of $275,000.&#160; Management has determined that goodwill is not impaired as of April 30, 2016 and 2015.&#160; The other intangible assets were amortized over a three-year period from the date of acquisition.&#160; Amortization expense for the year ended April 30, 2015 was approximately $73,000. As of April 30, 2015 these intangible assets were fully amortized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 24.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	11.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Employee Benefit Plans
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 22.3PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 24.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT">
	Profit Sharing Plan:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company provides its U.S.-based employees with a profit sharing plan and trust under section 401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code.&#160; This plan allows all eligible employees to defer a portion of their income through voluntary contributions to the plan.&#160; In accordance with the provisions of the plan, the Company can make discretionary matching contributions in the form of cash or common stock.&#160; For the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, the Company contributed 46,743 and 40,324 shares of common stock, respectively.&#160; The approximate value of these shares at the date of contribution was $498,000 in fiscal year 2016 and $485,000 in fiscal year 2015.&#160; Contributed shares are drawn from the Company&#8217;s common stock held in treasury and are removed at the Company&#8217;s original cost of acquisition of such shares on a specific identification basis.&#160; In addition to changes in the treasury stock accounts, during fiscal years 2016 and 2015, such transactions increased additional paid in capital by $283,000 and $302,000, respectively.&#160;&#160; As of April 30, 2016,&#160; all shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock held by the two plans were combined for an aggregate holding of 790,136 shares, which are allocated to the accounts of the individual participants.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	36
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#FREQUENCYELE10K043016_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27.35PT">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160; -&#160; Continued
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	April 30, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	On May 6, 2015, the ESOP Plan (see below) was merged into the Company&#8217;s profit sharing plan.&#160;
</FONT>
	As of April 30, 2015, the profit sharing plan held an aggregate of 467,975 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock allocated to the accounts of the individual participants.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	Income Incentive Pool:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company maintains incentive bonus programs for certain employees which are based on operating profits of the individual subsidiaries to which the employees are assigned.&#160; The Company also adopted a plan for the President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, which formula is based on consolidated pre-tax profits.&#160; Under these plans, the Company charged approximately $0.7 million and $1.3 million to selling and administrative expenses for the fiscal years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 22.3PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Employee Stock Plans
</FONT>
	:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company has various stock plans, some of which have been approved by the Company&#8217;s stockholders, for key management employees, including officers and directors who are employees, certain consultants and independent members of the Board of Directors.&#160; The plans are Nonqualified Stock Options (&#8220;NQSO&#8221;) plans, Incentive Stock Option ("ISO&#8221;) plans and Stock Appreciation Rights (&#8220;SARS&#8221;).&#160; Under these plans, options or SARS are granted at the discretion of the Stock Option Committee at an exercise price not less than the fair market value of the Company's common stock on the date of grant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Typically, options and SARS vest over a four-year period from the date of grant.&#160; The options and SARS generally expire ten years after the date of grant (the most recent SAR award expires in five years) and are subject to certain restrictions on transferability of the shares obtained on exercise.&#160; Under the Company&#8217;s 2005 Stock Award Plan (&#8220;Plan&#8221;) the Company provided option holders the opportunity to exercise stock options either by paying the exercise price for the shares or to do a cashless exercise whereby the individual receives the net number of shares of stock equal in value to the exercised number of shares times the difference between the current market value of the Company&#8217;s stock and the exercise price.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Under the Plan, instruments granted under other plans which expire, are canceled, or are tendered in the exercise of such instruments, increase the shares available under the Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	As of April 30, 2013, a consultant, who is the son of the Company&#8217;s president, had been granted options to purchase 37,500 shares of Company stock under NQSO plans at a weighted average exercise price of $6.67.&#160; During the year ended April 30, 2015, the consultant elected cashless exercises of 20,000 shares at an exercise price of $6.67, resulting in a net issuance of 8,638 shares. As of April 30, 2015, the consultant has no outstanding stock options.&#160; At the beginning of fiscal year 2015, eligible employees had been granted options to purchase approximately 172,500 shares of which 95,000 options with a weighted average exercise price of $13.15 were outstanding and exercisable.&#160; During the year ended April 30, 2015, 57,000 options expired and were returned to the Plan.&#160; The remaining 38,000 shares were exercised by the employees using the cashless method resulting in the net issuance of 6,931 shares of Company stock.&#160; Total fiscal year 2015 cashless exercises of stock options under ISO and NQSO plans, including the consultant shares above, aggregated 58,000 shares.&#160; Accordingly, the Company issued 15,569 shares on exercise and returned 42,431 shares to the pool of available shares which may be used for future grants under the Plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	&#160;As of April 30, 2016, eligible employees and directors have been granted SARS based on approximately 2,021,000 shares of Company stock, of which approximately 1,653,000 shares are outstanding and approximately 1,314,000 shares with a weighted average exercise price of $8.45 are exercisable.&#160; As of April 30, 2015, eligible employees and directors had been granted SARS based on approximately 1,950,000 shares of Company stock, of which approximately 1,603,000 shares were outstanding and approximately 1,131,000 shares with a weighted average exercise price of $8.27 were exercisable.&#160; When the SARS become exercisable, the Company will settle the SARS by issuing to exercising recipients the number of shares of stock equal to the appreciated value of the Company&#8217;s stock between the grant date and exercise date.&#160; At the time of exercise, the quantity of shares under the SARS grant equal to the exercise value divided by the then market value of the shares will be returned to the pool of available shares for future grant under the Plan.&#160; During the year ended April 30, 2016, employees exercised SARS representing 19,500 shares of Company stock and received 5,736 shares of Company stock.&#160; The 13,764 share difference was returned to the pool of available shares and may be used for future grants. During the year ended April 30, 2015, employees exercised SARS representing 147,500 shares of Company stock and received 70,675 shares of Company stock.&#160; The 76,825 share difference was returned to the pool of available shares and may be used for future grants.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	37
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 13%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	As of April 30, 2016, total unrecognized compensation cost related to nonvested options and stock appreciation rights under the plans was approximately $1,094,000.&#160; These costs are expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2.3 years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	During the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, 151,500 and 244,625 shares, respectively, vested, the fair value of which was approximately $661,000 and $1,053,000, respectively.&#160; The weighted average grant date fair value of stock appreciation rights granted during the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, were approximately $4.06 and $4.45, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	Stock-based compensation costs capitalized as part of work in process inventory or included in the cost of sales of programs on which the Company recognizes revenue under the percentage of completion method were approximately $265,000 and $394,000 for the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.&#160; Selling and administrative expenses include stock-based compensation expense of approximately $559,000 and $683,000 for the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company classifies cash flows resulting from the tax benefits from tax deductions recognized upon the exercise of stock options or SARS (tax benefits) as financing cash flows.&#160; For the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, the Company realized $141,000 and $200,000 respectively, of tax benefits from the exercise of stock options and SARS.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">

	38
</FONT>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#FREQUENCYELE10K043016_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27.35PT">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160; -&#160; Continued
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	April 30, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 22.3PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT">
	Independent Contractor Stock Option Plan:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company had an Independent Contractor Stock Option Plan under which up to 350,000 shares could be granted.&#160; This plan was terminated in fiscal year 2006.&#160; An Independent Contractor Stock Option Committee determined to whom options may be granted from among eligible participants, the timing and duration of option grants, the option price, and the number of shares of common stock subject to each option.&#160; Options were granted to certain independent contractors at a price equal to the then fair market value of the Company&#8217;s common stock.&#160; The options were exercisable over specified periods per terms of the individual agreements.&#160; No compensation expense was recorded during the year ended April 30, 2015 as no other grants were made in those years and previous grants have been fully expensed.&#160; As a result of the adoption by the stockholders of the 2005 Stock Award Plan, the Independent Contractor Stock Option Plan was discontinued.&#160; No additional grants will be made under this plan and the outstanding grant of an option for 30,000 shares at an exercise price of $14.76 expired during fiscal year 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 22.3PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 33.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT">
	Restricted Stock Plan:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	During fiscal year 1990, the Company adopted a Restricted Stock Plan which provided that key management employees could be granted rights to purchase an aggregate of 375,000 shares of the Company's common stock.&#160; The grants, transferability restrictions and purchase price were determined at the discretion of a special committee of the board of directors.&#160; The purchase price could not be less than the par value of the common stock.&#160; Transferability of shares is restricted for a four-year period, except in the event of a change in control as defined.&#160; As a result of the adoption by the Company&#8217;s stockholders of the 2005 Stock Award Plan, the Restricted Stock Plan was discontinued.&#160; No additional grants will be made under this plan.&#160; As of April 30, 2016 and 2015, grants for 7,500 shares are available to be purchased at a price of $4.00 per share.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 22.3PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 33.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT">
	Employee Stock Ownership Plan/Stock Bonus Plan:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	During 1990, the Company amended its Stock Bonus Plan to become an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (&#8220;ESOP&#8221;).&#160; By means of a bank note, subsequently repaid, the Company reacquired 561,652 shares of its common stock during fiscal year 1990.&#160; These shares plus approximately 510,000 additional shares issued by the Company from its authorized, unissued shares were sold to the ESOP in May 1990.&#160; Shares were released for allocation to participants based on a formula as specified in the ESOP document.&#160; By the end of fiscal year 2000, all shares (1,071,652) had been allocated to participant accounts of which 385,626 shares remain in the ESOP.&#160; On May 6, 2015, the ESOP plan was merged into the Company&#8217;s profit sharing plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 32.4PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 33.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: -32.4PT">
	Deferred Compensation Agreements:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company has a series of agreements with key employees providing for the payment of benefits upon retirement or death.&#160; Under these agreements, each key employee receives specified retirement payments for the remainder of the employee's life with a minimum payment of ten years' benefits to either the employee or his beneficiaries.&#160; The agreements also provide for lump sum payments upon termination of employment without cause and reduced benefits upon early retirement.&#160; The Company pays the benefits out of its working capital, but has also purchased whole life or term life insurance policies on the lives of certain of the participants to cover the optional lump sum obligations of the agreements upon the death of the participant.&#160; Deferred compensation expense charged to selling and administrative expenses during the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015 was approximately $959,000 and $1,038,000, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27.35PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	April 30, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 33.3PT">
	Life Insurance Policies and Cash Held in Trust:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The whole-life insurance policies on the lives of certain participants covered by deferred compensation agreements have been placed in a trust.&#160; Upon the death of any insured participant, cash received from life insurance policies in excess of the Company&#8217;s deferred compensation obligations to the estate or beneficiaries of the deceased, are also placed in the trust.&#160; These assets belong to the Company until a change of control event, as defined in the trust agreement, should occur.&#160; At that time, the Company is required to add sufficient cash to the trust so as to match the deferred compensation liability described above.&#160; Such funds will be used to continue the deferred compensation arrangements following a change of control.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT">

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	A valuation allowance is provided when it is more likely than not that some portion, or all, of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. We consider the level of historical income, scheduled reversal of temporary differences, tax planning strategies and projected future taxable income in determining whether a valuation allowance is warranted. The valuation allowance of $3.3 million as of April 30, 2016, is intended to provide for uncertainty regarding the ultimate realization of U.S. state investment tax credit carryovers and foreign net operating loss and tax credit carryovers. Based on these considerations, we believe it is more likely than not that we will realize the benefit of the net deferred tax asset of $10.8 million as of April 30, 2016, which is net of the valuation allowance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The consolidated valuation allowance increased by approximately $890,000 during the year ended April 30, 2016.&#160; The change consists of an $830,000 deferred tax provision plus a foreign exchange adjustment and reclass of deferred state taxes of $60,000.&#160; For the year ended April 30, 2015, the change in valuation allowance was an increase of $270,000 which consists of the $760,000 deferred tax provision less a foreign exchange adjustment of $490,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	At April 30, 2016, the Company has available approximately $6.4 million in net operating losses available to offset future income of certain of its foreign subsidiaries.&#160; These loss carryforwards have no expiration date.&#160; As a result of the acquisition of FEI-Elcom, the Company has a federal net operating loss carryforward of $4.4 million which may be applied in annually limited amounts to offset future U.S.-sourced taxable income over the next 15 years. As of April 30, 2016, the Company has state investment tax credits and foreign research and development credits of $838,000 and $425,000, respectively.&#160; The state investment tax credit expires beginning in 2023 through 2031.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	41
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A HREF="#FREQUENCYELE10K043016_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160; -&#160; Continued
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	April 30, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company has evaluated its tax positions and has concluded that the tax positions meet the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold as specified under accounting standards. As such, the amount of unrecognized tax benefits at April 30, 2016 and April 30, 2015 were $0. As of April 30, 2016 and April 30, 2015 the Company had $0, accrued for the payment of interest and penalties.&#160; It is difficult to predict or estimate the change in the Company&#8217;s unrecognized tax benefits over the next twelve months as a result of the progression of ongoing tax audits or other events.&#160; The Company believes, however, that there should be no change during the next twelve months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company is subject to taxation in the U.S. and various state, local and foreign jurisdictions. Net operating losses generated by domestic and foreign entities in closed years and utilized in open years are subject to adjustment by the tax authorities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
<U>
	Segment Information
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
	The Company operates under three reportable segments based on the geographic locations of its subsidiaries:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZB26F1BC387C34B31A96DA950D8581D73" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 58.5PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 40.5PT">
	(1)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	FEI-NY &#8211; operates out of New York and its operations consist principally of precision time and frequency control products used in three principal markets- communication satellites (both commercial and U.S. Government-funded); terrestrial cellular telephone or other ground-based telecommunication stations and other components and systems for the U.S. military.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="Z64595E00510E45B59ABFF4B39F15584C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 58.5PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 40.5PT">
	(2)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Gillam-FEI - operates out of Belgium and France and primarily sells wireline synchronization and network management systems in non-U.S. markets.&#160; All sales from Gillam-FEI to the United States are to other segments of the Company.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZD3131AEA556442A2A7C566ABD53738AF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 58.5PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 40.5PT">
	(3)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	FEI-Zyfer &#8211; operates out of California and its products incorporate Global Positioning System (GPS) technologies into systems and subsystems for secure communications, both government and commercial, and other locator applications.&#160; This segment also provides sales and support for the Company&#8217;s wireline telecommunications family of products, including US5G, which are sold in the United States market.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The FEI-NY segment also includes the operations of the Company&#8217;s wholly-owned subsidiaries, FEI-Elcom and FEI-Asia.&#160; FEI-Asia functions as a manufacturing facility for the FEI-NY segment with historically minimal sales to outside customers.&#160; Beginning in late fiscal year 2014, FEI-Asia began shipping higher volumes of product to third parties as a contract manufacturer.&#160; FEI-Elcom, in addition to its own product line, provides design and technical support for the FEI-NY segment&#8217;s satellite business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer measures segment performance based on total revenues and profits generated by each geographic location rather than on the specific types of customers or end-users.&#160; Consequently, the Company determined that the segments indicated above most appropriately reflect the way the Company&#8217;s management views the business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The accounting policies of the three segments are the same as those described in the &#8220;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies.&#8221;&#160; The Company evaluates the performance of its segments and allocates resources to them based on operating profit which is defined as income before investment income, interest expense and taxes.&#160; The European-based director of Gillam-FEI and the president of FEI-Zyfer manage the assets of these segments.&#160; All acquired assets, including intangible assets, are included in the assets of these two segments.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">

	**For fiscal years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, includes Gillam-FEI intersegment sales of $847,000 and $1.5 million, respectively, to the
</FONT>
	FEI-NY
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	and FEI-Zyfer segments.&#160; Such sales consist principally of design and development of automatic test equipment for satellite hardware production and manufacture of assemblies and units of a wireline synchronization product for ultimate production and sale in the U.S.&#160; In the Gillam-FEI segment, these transactions reduced the operating loss in each of the fiscal years.

	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160; -&#160; Continued
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	April 30, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 5PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 24.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.7PT">
<U>
	Major Customers
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company's products are sold to both commercial and governmental customers.&#160; For the years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015, approximately 60% and 47% respectively, of the Company's sales were made under contracts to the U.S. Government or subcontracts for U.S. Government end-use.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	In fiscal year 2016, sales to four customers of the FEI-NY segment aggregated $30.7 million or 69% of that segment&#8217;s total sales.&#160; Two of these customers also exceeded 10% of the Company&#8217;s consolidated revenues. During the year ended April 30, 2016, in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Gillam-FEI
</FONT>
	segment, sales to one customer exceeded 10% of that segment&#8217;s revenues.&#160; In the FEI-Zyfer segment, two customers accounted for more than 10% of that segment&#8217;s sales.&#160;&#160; None of the customers in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Gillam-FEI
</FONT>
	and FEI-Zyfer segments accounted for more than 10% of consolidated revenues.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	In fiscal year 2015, sales to three customers of the FEI-NY segment aggregated $33.1 million or 53% of that segment&#8217;s total sales.&#160; Each of these customers also exceeded 10% of the Company&#8217;s consolidated revenues.&#160; During the year ended April 30, 2015, in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Gillam-FEI
</FONT>
	segment, sales to one customer exceeded 10% of that segment&#8217;s revenues.&#160; In the FEI-Zyfer segment, two customers accounted for more than 10% of that segment&#8217;s sales.&#160; None of the customers in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Gillam-FEI
</FONT>
	and FEI-Zyfer segments accounted for more than 10% of consolidated revenues.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The loss by the Company of any one of these customers would have a material adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s business.&#160; The Company believes its relationship with these customers to be mutually satisfactory.&#160; Sales to major customers above can include commercial and governmental end users.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 5PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.7PT">
<U>
	Foreign Sales
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 4PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	Revenues in each of the Company&#8217;s segments include sales to foreign governments or to companies located in foreign countries.&#160; Revenues, based on the location of the procurement entity and excluding intersegment sales, were derived from the following countries:
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company generally provides its customers with a one-year warranty regarding the manufactured quality and functionality of its products.&#160; For some limited products, the warranty period has been extended.&#160; The Company establishes warranty reserves based on its product history, current information on repair costs and annual sales levels.&#160; Changes in the carrying amount of accrued product warranty costs are as follows (in thousands):
</DIV>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
<U>
<A NAME="FREQUENCYELE10K043016_HTM_ITEM9A_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
<A NAME="FREQUENCYELE10K043016_HTM_ITEM9A">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 9A.&#160; Controls and Procedures
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</U>
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	The Company&#8217;s management, with the participation of the Company&#8217;s chief executive officer and chief financial officer, has evaluated the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures (as such term is defined in Rules 13a&#8209;15(e) and 15d&#8209;15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;)) as of the end of the period covered by this report.&#160; There are inherent limitations to the effectiveness of any system of disclosure controls and procedures, including the possibility of human error and the circumvention or overriding of the controls and procedures.&#160; Accordingly, even effective disclosure controls and procedures can only provide reasonable assurance of achieving their control objectives.&#160; Based on their evaluation, the Company&#8217;s chief executive officer and chief financial officer have concluded that, as of April 30, 2016, the Company&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures were effective.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<U>
	Management&#8217;s Annual Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	Management of Frequency Electronics is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting as defined in Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) under the Exchange Act.&#160; The Company&#8217;s internal control system is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.&#160; Because of inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.&#160; Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	Management has assessed the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of April 30, 2016.&#160; In making this assessment, management used the criteria established in Internal Control
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#8212;
</FONT>
	Integrated Framework (2013) issued i by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.&#160; Based on this evaluation, management has concluded that the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting were effective as of April 30, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	A material weakness is a deficiency, or a combination of deficiencies, in internal control over financial reporting, such that there is a reasonable possibility that a material misstatement of the Company&#8217;s annual or interim financial statements will not be prevented or detected on a timely basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<U>
	Financial Reporting
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	This annual report does not include an attestation report of the Company&#8217;s registered public accounting firm regarding internal control over financial reporting.&#160; Management&#8217;s report was not subject to attestation by the Company&#8217;s registered public accounting firm pursuant to rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission that permit the Company to provide only management&#8217;s report in this annual report.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</U>
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	There were no changes in the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting (as such term is defined in Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) under the Exchange Act) during the year ended April 30, 2016 to which this report relates that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 29.7PT">
	FREQUENCY ELECTRONICS, INC. and SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	List of Subsidiaries of Registrant
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<TABLE ID="Z02C9AE5D206E419DA2C5CB04FB9B3E84" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 80%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 40%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	Subsidiary &amp; Name under
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 40%">
	&#160;
</TD>

<DIV>
<BR>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 72PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.8PT">
	We consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statements of Frequency Electronics, Inc. on Form S-8 (Nos. 333-08901, 333-40506, 333-140938, 333-156600, 333-42233 and 333-188952) of our report dated July 29, 2016 on our audits of the consolidated financial statements as of April 30, 2016 and 2015 and for each of the years then ended which report is included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K to be filed on or about July 29, 2016.

<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<A NAME="EX31-1_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_31>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Exhibit 31.1
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	Certification
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	I, Martin B. Bloch, certify that:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	1.&#160; I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Frequency Electronics, Inc.;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	2.&#160; Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	3.&#160; Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	4.&#160; The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(a)&#160; Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(b)&#160; Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(c)&#160; Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(d)&#160; Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	5.&#160; The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(a)&#160; All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(b)&#160; Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	Date:&#160; July 29, 2016
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	By
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
<U>
	/s/ Martin B. Bloch
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PX; DISPLAY: INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH: 144PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	Martin B. Bloch
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	Chief Executive Officer
</DIV>
</EFX_CERTIFICATION>

<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31_2"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Exhibit 31.2
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	Certification
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	I, Steven L. Bernstein, certify that:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	1.&#160; I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Frequency Electronics, Inc.;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	2.&#160; Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	3.&#160; Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	4.&#160; The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(a)&#160; Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(b)&#160; Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(c)&#160; Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(d)&#160; Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	5.&#160; The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(a)&#160; All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 28.8PT">
	(b)&#160; Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
